intro: Eriodes barbata, commonly known as the hairy eriodes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Eriodes barbata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil.
